primaryOutcome.outcome: Time from reversal of heparin with protamine sulphate to chest closure

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Number of units/volume of fresh frozen plasma (FFP) and/or platelets and/or red-cell concentrates transfused during surgery and in the post-surgery period

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Signed informed consent obtained from parent or legal guardian before any trial-related activities. Trial-related activities are any procedure that would not have been performed during normal management of the subject
- Children with complex congenital heart disease requiring corrective surgery with cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB)
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: - Congenital heart disease that does not require CPB surgery

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This trial is conducted in Oceania. The aim of this trial is to investigate the efficacy of activated recombinant human factor VII and standard treatment compared with standard haemostatic replacement therapy in cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB) surgery for paediatric congenital heart disease.
